public ref class SymbolDisplay abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Displays a symbol in the C# style.

Docs.param: The value that the resulting character literal should have.
True to put (single) quotes around the character literal.
Docs.summary: Returns a C# character literal with the given value.

Docs.param: The value that the resulting string literal should have.
True to put (double) quotes around the string literal.
Docs.summary: Returns a C# string literal with the given value.

Docs.param: A value to display as a string.

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of an object of primitive type.
Docs.returns: A string representation of an object of primitive type (or null if the type is not supported).

Docs.param: The formatting options to apply. If null is passed, will be used.
Docs.summary: Convert a symbol to an array of string parts, each of which has a kind. Useful for colorizing the display string.
Docs.remarks: Parts are not localized until they are converted to strings.

Docs.param: The formatting options to apply. If null is passed, will be used.
Docs.summary: Displays a symbol in the C# style, based on a .
Docs.returns: A formatted string that can be displayed to the user.
Docs.remarks: The return value is not expected to be syntactically valid C#.

Docs.param: Semantic information about the context in which the symbol is being displayed.
The formatting options to apply. If null is passed, will be used.
Docs.summary: Displays a symbol in the C# style, based on a . Based on the context, qualify type and member names as little as possible without introducing ambiguities.
Docs.returns: A formatted string that can be displayed to the user.
Docs.remarks: The return value is not expected to be syntactically valid C#.
